channel.title: MoparScape Server Status Page
channel.description:
The new server status page is great! Yet, when you want to update your server, you have decide, don't update or lose spot on server status list.
It has been a concern to me, why shoul we lose our server ranks on the server status page if we want to update something? You cannot say that the sponsored servers are all online 100%, cause they aren't. Some servers are new, and want to update a lot. Moparscape server status page isn't allowing you to update your server anymore because of the fact that you lose your spot.
Example...
Say you are ranked number 1 in the list(not sponsored servers)
You want to update you server, do you risk losing the oppertunity to make your server popular? Or fix a major duping bug?
It isn't the best thing to just leave a duping problem left untreated, but it isn't ethical for you to lose your spot.
If you support the idea of giving servers at least 10 seconds of downtime before they get De-Ranked, post back saying you support.

item.title: MoparScape Server Status Page
item.dc:creator: @WS317_EOS WS317 EOS
item.description:
@WS317_EOS wrote:

I agree, they should at least allow 10 seconds to restart the server. Most auto-Restarters don’t work that fast, so unstable servers are SOL

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape Server Status Page
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

Well, ever since i made objects load from config files, client.java went down 50kb.

Ever since I added a new parsepacket system(just imports the packets from seperate java files, actionbuttons.java ect…)

That reduced client.java by 120kb

I put commands in a seperate java file. That reduced 10kb

I made guild info load from config files, that reduced 22kb

I looked at a method for checking if an object exists, I replaced the position of the object with the object ID.

Now it loads all objects from 1-10000 (I have some custom objects)

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape Server Status Page
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

[quote=“wolfs goal, post:6, topic:322282”][quote author=Espeon link=topic=418676.msg3076905#msg3076905 date=1261892472]

create a system that updates the server without being restarted

That’s close to impossible…
[/quote]

Maybe not, I mean you can just Re-Load all the java files.

Like make a ::update command…

And have it do like

loadClient(loadClient.java)

IDK… I just think it’s bs…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 26, 2009, 11:45:19 pm[/size][hr][quote author=JaydenD12 link=topic=418676.msg3076909#msg3076909 date=1261892623]
You could restart your server really fast, I’m sure that the server status page doesn’t update every 2 seconds.
[/quote]

LOL…

My server has to load 2 XML documents, not only that it has to load like 20 config files.

I have it set up this way to reduce the sizes of java files…[/quote]

Whatever you say.

Read full topic

That’s close to impossible…[/quote]

Maybe not, I mean you can just Re-Load all the java files.

loadClient(loadClient.java)

IDK… I just think it’s bs…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 26, 2009, 11:45:19 pm[/size][hr][quote=“JaydenD12, post:4, topic:322282”]You could restart your server really fast, I’m sure that the server status page doesn’t update every 2 seconds.[/quote]

LOL…

My server has to load 2 XML documents, not only that it has to load like 20 config files.

I have it set up this way to reduce the sizes of java files…

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape Server Status Page
item.dc:creator: @CAPT_AMERIKA AMERIKA
item.description:
@CAPT_AMERIKA wrote:

[quote=“Espeon, post:3, topic:322282”][quote author=AMERIKA link=topic=418676.msg3076897#msg3076897 date=1261892249]
create a system that updates the server without being restarted
[/quote]

That’s close to impossible…[/quote]
false. not if you implement a scripting system or something along those lines. then the only times you would need to restart the server is when you’re going to update the script system/server frame.

Read full topic
